definition: to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: In the household, young kids are imbued with concept of self-reliance.
sentences.chinese: 在家庭中，孩子从小就被灌输自立自强的观念。

sentences.english: I have learnt to be more independent and self-reliant.
sentences.chinese: 我学会更加独立与自立自强。

sentences.english: Nowadays, aged man is really preferred to choose those free-standing self-improvement women.
sentences.chinese: 这个年代，男人真正比较喜欢是那些自立自强的女人。

definition: lit. to eat off one's own strength (idiom)/fig. to stand on one's own feet/to earn one's own living
independent and autonomous (idiom); self-determination/to act independently/to maintain control over one's own affairs
self-respect/self-love/self-regard/regard for oneself/to cherish one's good name/to take good care of one's health
to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
poor but with great ambitions (idiom)/poor but principled
hardworking and thrifty in running one's household
independent/self-reliant/self-sustaining/to stand on one's own feet/to support oneself
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
to become rich by one's own efforts/self-made
